name: Le Saint-Pierre Auberge

reviews.text: This hotel is well located within the historic area of Quebec City. Keep in mind that old Quebec City, as well as being a historic site, is a major tourist town. Particularly during summer and early fall months (and winter carnival) the costs of a hotel room can be high (for not very much of a room) and meals are overpriced for what you get. The Saint Pierre staff were very friendly and the atmosphere cosy. Prices are reasonable for Quebec City. We had to change rooms for the two night stay. The first room was basic and sufficient for a good night's sleep. The second room was at street level- more roomy and a good deal for the price.
reviews.title: Okay for Quebec City

reviews.text: The continental breakfast consisted of small muffins and tea or coffee.
reviews.title: Delightful Any Way You Look At It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are probably better places to stay in Quebec City, but we chose to spend our time seeing this amazing city, rather than looking for options. After all, we only needed a good place to sleep and a place in the old city to easily walk to the sites of interest. The Saint Pierre provided both.
reviews.title: Auberge St-Pierre_Great Hotel and Location

reviews.text: We've just returned from a marvelous four night stay in Vieux Quebec (Old Quebec City) at the Auberge St. Pierre. From start to finish, it was completely delightful and well worth the price (179 CAN) minus 10% for a AAA discount. My friend and I stayed in a very lovely, quiet room (#102) with two double beds (Queen) and wonderful hard wood floors. Not only was the room spotless, it had every small touch imaginable, from two luxurious robes, spa tub, extra umbrella, hairdryer, coffee maker, windows that open, to a desk, side chair, and TV! The location in lower town was convenient to fine restaurants (such as Initiale and Toast), shopping, historic sites, and the St. Lawrence River. The staff was exceptional and provided superior service and assistance (in French or English). Did I mention breakfast was included? As Americans, it was helpful to start the day and not have to worry about finding something to eat. If you want an authentic Quebec experience in a charming, full service, top notch auberge (aka small hotel) I highly recommend Auberge St. Pierre.
reviews.title: Outstanding service
What a lovely stay!!!
reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed a 2 night stay at the Auberge Saint-Pierre. Our room was on the 4th floor. The room was adequate for two persons. Very clean, with comfortable furnishing. Very quiet hotel and location.

reviews.title: Charming, quaint hotel
reviews.text: I spent 5 nights at the Auberge St. Pierre and loved the hotel -- the location, the staff, the accomodations. The location was perfect for me since I love to walk -- and did so everywhere, navigating the steep incline to visit the upper city, or walking the short distance to the port to watch the huge cruise ships pull into port.

reviews.title: Perfect location, beautiful room, excellent service!
reviews.text: Out the back door, only a short distance away, there are numerous restaurants with varied cuisine and right across the street is a Subway, if you want to eat "American."
Shops and art galleries abound as one navigates throughout the lower city and into the upper reaches.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: I was given the room posted on the website with the plaid duvet and enjoyed having the table to work on, as well as the small stereo system to listen to my new Diana Krall CD.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel -- mixture of old world European charm with modern comforts
Nice, but not at all exceptional
reviews.text: My only "complaint," if you want to call it that, is the low lighting in the room. The room had steps up to the bathroom and the lower step was poorly illuminated which would make it difficult for someone with vision problems to navigate.

Had a wonderful visit to Auberge St-Pierre with five friends. All of us agreed we would return to this charming inn. Friendly staff, lots of Q.C. ambiance, very comfortable and a location that can't be beat if you want to explore Vieux Quebec. Parfait!
reviews.title: Highly recommend Auberge St-Pierre
Beautiful, small, and quaint
reviews.text: This hotel is wonderful in every way -- hotel staff is exceptionally friendly and attentive, the daily breakfast is exquisite, our room was cozy/clean/quaint, and the location is perfect as it is far enough away from the tourist-central part of town but close enough to walk there in a few minutes. I truly enjoyed my 5-day stay at the Auberge St-Pierre and highly recommend it to future visitors!

This hotel has a great location on a quaint street in Lower Town Quebec City. It is a 3 minute walk to Place Royale (a gorgeous cobble-stoned square) and Le Petit Champlain--the narrow shopping street just below the Chateau Frontenac, and the cruise terminal. It is even within a 15-20 minute walk of the Gare du Palais (VIA Rail train station). The rooms have exposed brick walls, thin down comforters, whirlpool baths (a nice plus) and are decorated in attractive colors. Breakfast (included with room) is served in a pretty dining room from 7-10 am and you choose from about 10 dishes each morning and they make it to order--things like yogurt and fruit, omlettes, french toast, crepes, and oatmeal. It is really nice and the server was so bright and friendly each morning. The only drawback for us was the construction noise nextdoor as they renovate another old building. They started about 8 am and served as our "wake-up call." This is out of the control of the hotel staff, but hopefully they contruction will be done soon. We loved it! Make sure to have a meal at the diner-stlye Le Buffet De L'antiquaire on Rue St. Paul (4 minute walk from hotel). Mostly locals were in there, but they served Quebec comfort food and it was very cheap and delicious. We felt is was a great way to experience the true local fare.
reviews.title: Lower Town gem
ripped off
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed there for three nights in July 2004 after reading all the wonderful reviews on trip advisor. Our stay in the hotel was very pleasant but our good experience during our stay turned into an awful experience once we received our credit card statement. Upon leaving the hotel we payed our bill in full, but when we came home and reviewed our credit card statements we found that some additional charges had been made to our credit card. On several occasions we wrote emails to the personnel of the hotel seeking an explanation for this additional charge, and more than three months later they have yet to respond. We are now trying to get the charge overturned through our credit card company since the personnel of the hotel has ignored us. Any good experience I had during my stay was soured by the dishonesty or lack of interest the people who run this hotel have shown towards our problem.

reviews.title: A great place to honeymoon
reviews.text: My husband and I researched hotels on this site and and decided this looked like the place to spend our honeymoon. What a great choice! We spent 3 nights of our honeymoon at the Auberge St. Piere in September 2004 and I would highly recommend it! The rooms were spacious with a beautiful French-country décor (wish I could recreate the room at home!). The staff was very kind and helpful with directions, restaurant information, and anything else we needed. There were quite a few meal selections for the complementary breakfast. We had something different each day and everything was very good. The only downside was that everyone must shower about an hour before the breakfast serving time ends (as I did) and there was no hot water left. I adjusted my shower time by an hour the next morning and was fine. We took the tour of the Chateau Frontenac (good tour!) and knew we had made the right choice with where to stay….those rooms were 3-4 times the price and quite small in comparison. I guess they are charging for being the token place to stay. Not worth it in our minds! We also loved the location of the Auberge St. Pierre…the hotel is located in a very quite section of the lower town but very close to some great restaurants and historic places. If you want to go to the upper part of the city and aren’t up for the stairs or incline, the Funicular is quite reasonable. We’re already planning our next visit to the Auberge St. Pierre!

reviews.title: LOVED!
reviews.text: I stayed at St. Pierre, what a wonderful staff! I was going to go for the more expensive hotel, St. Antoine, but I am glad I didnt. The location was great, the room was very clean and neat, and I loved the art work and rugged brick and stone walls. Anything I asked for, or recommendations from the staff, I received good information, especially when it came to events and dining. I would go back in a heart beat! The 7 hour drive was well worth it.

We loved it, loved it, loved it! The hotel is in a terrific location and the rooms are quite charming -- but the friendly service is what makes this hotel unforgettable... The level of personalized service was really quite remarkable.
reviews.title: great staff, great location

description: It is no small wonder that Le Saint Pierre is one of Quebec City’s most sought-after properties. The combined beauty and elegance of its 200 year-old façade with the natural warmth of its interior with parquet flooring and exposed stone and brick walls is, quite simply, beautiful.Fine hotel elegance and incomparable, intimate Old Quebec charm make our 31 rooms and 10 Suites a winning combination for all our guests.Cozy, warm, dynamic atmosphere as well as complimentary breakfast and Internet access await you at Le Saint Pierre, Auberge Distinctive.
